review: i don't think this place deserves 2 stars.. Its a chain restaurant in a malll... you get what you get, haha... It's convenient, has a variety of food, and its open super late (which I can't say for many places in the SCV)..  I think what made my last experience so great was our amazing server in the bar on Friday night (2/3/2012)... I unfortunately do not remember her name but she is slender, maybe Hispanic, and has long straight black hair.. maybe try to find her?  She was very nice, funny, and attentive.. she even managed to keep track of our different bills at our large table.. I am a huge fan of great customer service and truly believe that it can make or break an establishment.. In this case, it really did.

When TGIFridays first came out, I loved them. All of them. But it seems they have gone downhill since they came onto the scene and this particular Fridays is hit and miss as to whether the food is cooked corrrectly or overdone. They have an extensive drink menu and they have varied choices of food which is nice when you just can't make up your mind what you want. However, I always go there with trepidation, wondering if the food will actually TASTE good once I get it. I'd choose other places over this one which is a shame because Fridays used to be great!

I promised to write a yelp review of this place just because of the service. Went to TGIF with a girlfriend for a casual dinner. We were blown away by the friendly, attentive staff.The food was standard Friday's- Ii's predictable but reliable and for some reason, you can't help but demolish your plate. OMG the mozarella sticks. We interacted with out 5 people that night and everyone was super nice, making jokes, and making us feel appreciated. It was great- definitely something to talk about!
Bottom-line, really great service. I have been to nearly all the local eats located at the Valencia Town Center and this place just has great service and the food is good too.

This place is awesome lol I had the best servers and the food was great!  sirloin was a little tough, appetizers are all great big portions (it can be shared) =] very clean and fast service... ( compare to other TGIF ) O__________O VERY STUFFED!! LOL

This was the first time I ever went to a TGI Friday's and I will say that the experience was alright. We had a family reservation for about twenty of us for a family member's 60th birthday. The seating arrangement was alright and the staff were very friendly (too friendly for my taste, almost talking to us like we were children...). Though I'd rather have an overly friendly staff than a bunch of jerks. The restaurant itself is very family oriented and has a decent atmosphere, we were close to the restrooms which I found convenient for such a large party.  I have wanted to try TGIF for awhile now, mostly because of its 2 for $20 deal. What I found very interesting was the fact that they DID NOT give you that menu. You have to specifically ask for it, otherwise you will not see it on the regular menu (at least not at this restaurant).  The 2 for $20 menu is quite limited, however this is expected. I believe you have about 6 entrees to choose from. In this deal you get: 1) Share a Shrimp Cocktail or Order any appetizer at same or lesser value (which would be $9.99, you can choose from almost all the appetizers).  2) Two Entrees (which has a choice of about six or seven entrees I think). 3) Share a Dessert Remember to look at SHARE - this means only one, which is fine to be honest. I had a hot chocolate (can't go wrong with a hot chocolate if you hate coffee). The mug is very large and you have lots of whip cream to go with it, yums. My mother and I skipped out on the Shrimp Cocktail and instead got the Fried Mozzarella which was quite delicious. For an entree I had the Petite Sirloin with french fries (yeah i suck at picking sides). I recommend you get some kind of vegetable in there for this meal. I ordered the sirloin medium well and it came out tough anyway. It was delicious at first but then toughened as I continued to eat it. The fries are yummy though.  My mother had the Pork Chops which was deliciously juicy and very much recommended.  For the dessert we shared the Brownie Obsession - that was heaven! That is a delicious dessert, big enough for two, maybe even three. The brownie was super hot, but that just meant it was fresh! It comes with a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top and pecan nuts.  Overall I was mostly disappointed with my sirloin... I usually don't get meat/steak at restaurants but I didn't want to get the usual chicken strips (which i regret now).  HOWEVER - I don't mind coming back to try the chicken strips and the pork chops and taste another delicious dessert. I personally would only recommend if you're just going out for no real reason and you're hungry, not for a date or party.

Mathew is an excellent server and didn't make us feel like he was in a hurry to get to his next table. The chicken and shrimp on top of cheese and onions and peppers and the salmon with lobster on top were both awesome and brought out sizzling hot as soon as they were ready.
cold food, inaccurate bill, bleh tasting food, only thing that saved it was the waitress was nice and willing to help.

Being generous with 2 stars. This place is going in the drain faster than a speeding bullet. I gave them 3 stars my last review, and they tanked on me. Service was slow, and food warm at best. We won't be going back for 5 more years.

Decided to make a trip to Valencia on a Sunday afternoon with a friend..after walking around the mall we made a stop at tgi for a drink. Ordered a bloodymary and it was one of the best I have ever had..deff not shy on booze. I am very satisfied with my drink.

It was a saturday evening and we came here during happy hour.  The waiter came by and told us that all the appetizers were half off except for the platter and the sampler.  The waiter took our drink order and we ordered a coke and water.  When the waiter came by again, I ordered a beer and couple appetizers.  We ordered the fried mozzarella and BBQ Chicken flatbread.  When the waiter left, I looked at the menu again to see what I ordered and I ordered the wrong appetizer.  When the waiter came back again with my been, I asked if it was possible to change my appetizer and the waiter said it would be ok.  So I ordered the buffalo wings.  I also ordered the Jack Daniels burger.  When the bill came out, all of this cost about $22.  I will have to go back there again.  All in all, the service was awesome and the waiter did a great job.  I was very happy with everything.

This place is mediocre at best. The food was OK, definitely have had better. I know not to expect much at a large chain restaurant but this place sucked. There's not much else to say. *kanye shrug* P.S. they deserved one additional star because they got a nice 20% military discount

One of the worse customer service, came here with a small party and it took forever to take our order and to receive our food. It was not a busy night, it was Wednesday around 9pm. Our waitress was just very inattentive and my food was cold. Avoid this restaurant.

This place was a bit of a disappointment. My girlfriend and I went here for one of those deals where you get two entrees for a set price. The entrees listed in the deal didn't look that great. The food we did end up getting was alright. I liked the BBQ burger I got, but my girlfriend's pasta left a lot to be desired. The service here was pretty lame. Our server asked us a few minutes after we were seated if we were ready to order. We said we weren't, and asked for a couple minutes. We ended up waiting 20 minutes for him to come back, despite several attempts to get his attention. Later, when he brought the check to us, he knocked over a glass of water and soaked everything on the table. He must have been having a bad night or something, but regardless, I'd rather avoid this location.

Kim Cameron, Valencia, CA Yee-ouch!!! TGI Fridays was only rated a 2.5/5 stars???!!!!!! Well that must be because some of these yelpers haven't tried the Cajun Shrimp and Chicken Pasta, Fried Mozzarella, and Cheesy Chicken Quesadilla!! They are all delish!! BUT!! I tried the Garden Burger several years ago and it was terrible!!! So, I guess I understand that this place is hit or miss...

Mimi at the bar is incredible with her dedication to service, efficiency and a friendly smile! I think fridays is really good during happy hour. The apps are half off and the drinks are at bargain price. If you want some beer and chicken wings go here and you can really fill up and have a good time on the cheap.  Downside in my opinion is that the mixed drinks are pretty week so don't expect "dive" bar pours! None the less it's Fridays and Happy Hour runs all day on Sunday! On weekday HH runs 3-7pm and 10pm-close.
Great lunch specials. I recommend ordering the Jack Daniels burger and the Toffee cake. If you eat before 3pm you can get a great price on lunch.

My issue is with the service.  The food is ok, not the best, not the worst.  Sign up on their website and you'll get a coupon for a free appetizer or dessert.   I'm part of a group that goes out to eat in the SCV every Tuesday night.  We pick Tuesday because restaurants are not normally busy and can handle our group.  Last night we had 14ppl and the restaurant wasn't busy, but service still took forever.  We didn't get our drinks until 30 min after we were seated.  We didn't give our orders until 40 min.  I finally got up to speak to a manager and he came over and said he would take care of us.  He handed me some free appetizer coupons so I passed those out and the group ordered a few apps.  Later, the manager came back over and gave me a few more.  We asked for some pitchers of soda so the overwhelmed server wouldn't have to keep coming over to refill drinks.  That seemed to work out well.  I had the cobb salad and it was fine.  The chicken was moist, the produce was fresh.  My partner had a flat iron steak that she ordered medium well and it came medium rare.  She ate around the rare parts and didn't complain.  We had the loaded chips for an appetizer and those were tasty.  A nice change from nachos.  I tasted the spinach dip too and that was good.  The food was ok, its a chain, what do you want?  I can always find something at a chain that will be acceptable.

I am so upset about my experience I swear I could just cry (because I had been looking forward to it)! Oh and trust me, I took pictures to show you how dripping blood and under-cooked the hamburger was! And to show you how the hamburger looks in the picture on the menu and on the commercial. Myyyyy burger had less then a 1/4 teaspoon of the sauce, and one tiny little itty bitty speck of an onion. NOTHING like how it looks on the menu or on the commercial! I had to request an order of the onions and sauce on the side! I drove all the way down to Valencia from Lancaster (an hour drive), specially because I had wanted to get that burger (had seen it on the commercial). Ohh yeah and when we first walked in, they were just standing around talking, goofing off and laughing with each other. She even looked at me standing there waiting for them and she didn't care. Fiiiiiinally she came over to us and said, "How many?" to seat us. WOW! Are you serious!? Other restaurants do not ever do that. How rude and unprofessional.  PRO'S: Our waiter was very nice and friendly! The margarita's were delicious! The bacon mac n' cheese bites were scrumptious! My boy friend liked it that they had the USC fight live on pay-per-view! My boyfriend and I had gone on Saturday August 1st 2013... XO!

Lackluster food for the price. I had a burger which was supposed to have melted cheddar and asiago cheese and a garlic aioli. The burger was cooked perfectly, but I couldn't taste the asiago, and the garlic aioli tasted an awful lot like plain mayonnaise. I might as well have gotten a plain cheddar cheese burger. The steak fries tasted more like cold chunks of potato with a crusty substance which was supposed to be parmesan (it tasted nothing of the sort) scantly sprinkled about. My wife's chicken was over-cooked, stringy, and crunchy. Yes, crunchy, nothing more to say on that. The deep fried green beans were still as good as at other locations, so I'll be generous and give this place 2 stars for friendly service and a decent appetizer.

I read the reviews and came in w/really low expectations.  Even w/that, i was VERY disappointed w/this restaurant.  Pitiful. I ordered a Jack Daniels chicken sandwich; my daughter ordered Korean steak tacos; my son got a kids meal pasta and marinara w/mandarin oranges.  It took over 25 minutes for our food and there was only a couple other tables occupied on a Tuesday night.  Then, our food FINALLY arrives and the server brought only my daughters plate and mine.  Really?!?!  Had to wait another 3 or 4 minutes for my sons dinner.   Fine, we're all served.  Guess what??  My chicken is cold and not the it's been sitting for 3 or 4 minutes waiting for the last dish to arrive cold,  Ice cold.  So is my daughters tacos.  WTF?!?!  Gotta wonder how long my meal was sitting waiting for the guy to bring it.  Food was ok at best.  My daughters mashed potatoes were the best tasting (and warmest) food we had.  How sad is that??  The tacos had very little steak in it and the bacon on my sandwich was over cooked (still cold, though) and too crunchy.  My son liked his spaghetti. We're done and i ask for the check (literally, i said "can we have the check please??) and the guy wants to know if we want coffee or dessert.  Really?!?!  What part of "can we have the check please??" did you not understand??  We're already late 'cuz we had to wait so long for our cold food...just bring me the dang check.   Horrible food, worse service.  I'll never set foot in this place again.

Terrible service, super slow on a Thursday night. Messed up our order waited almost an hour for my sons chicken fingers. Really. This place has gone downhill. We will never return. I have other options and it will not be here.

I don't know how the food is, but I know the service isn't.  I went here with the kids and we were seated at a table.  After 15 min. of waiting, no one had taken our drink order yet or acknowledged us.  We left....
As usual, Friday's never let's me down! Their food is as awesome as always, and it was definitely worth taking a small detour to get here.

I don't know what is going on with the TGI Friday's at this location in Valencia.  My family & I have been here twice & both times the service was terrible.  The waiter both times took FOREVER to get a simple drink order.  When our drinks did run out we had to sit there and wait for a while before our waiter would come by to ask about a refill.  Then to get the refill would take another 5 - 10 minutes.  On the first occasion we had to complain because our order was completely wrong, and the manager was really nice & he gave us a free meal & a free desert.  On the second occasion we didn't complain because the management was busy dealing with some other irate customer.  We aren't sure if we want to return to this location.  We really love TGI Friday's but hate the service at the one in Valenica.

The food was very tasty, we had dinner there last night and to our surprise they were on happy hour, since we brought kids they allowed us to order from the happy hour menu in the regular sitting zone. Their pretzel bread was DELISHIOUS and the sauce it comes with even better. Service was really good as well. Will definetely go back.

Just went here with my wife and kids. My last day off before returning to work from holiday break so I wanted to eat somewhere I never been. We landed here at Fridays since we had a 25% off the bill coupon and I've always heard great things about the appetizers. We were seated promptly but everything was downhill from there. We weren't offered any drinks for at least 10 minutes, The drinks (adios) and the (mango mai Thai) were weaker that an Odouls with a splash of bud light. I ordered extra cheese on the nachos, upon their arrival it appears they were low on cheese, as well the cheese was not even melted. The entire plate was cold to the last bite. Hungry as we were, we continued. The food came, I went with the double stacked burger, the wife with a regular one. The kids both got the ribs. The fries were all cold and tasted rather old, the burger wasn't anything to write home about either but it sufficed. Our waitress seemed to keep getting lost inside (we were seated outside) and come time for the bill we waited a good 10 min or so for her to return to get that. All in all. Its TGI Fridays... wasn't expecting wolf creek but jeez, this place really sucks for service and food. I don't think I'll be thanking anyone its Friday and time soon.

Took family to TGIF 24201 Valencia Blvd Ste 102, Valencia, CA on Saturday Jan 4. 3 out of 4 had chicken Quesadilla, same 3 got sick that night and next day. My son was throwing up all day the next day, my daughter had terrible headaches and my wife had the runs. Food poisoning. Been going there a lot the last six months, the service has gone downhill the food has definitely gone downhill. Won't be going back.

Wow we came in to the place at 11:00 am  and my daughter asked for seating for 6. Mind you there was only one couple eating in the Resturant. She came to seat us and my daughter said sorry we have only five I miscounted. The greeter gave us the biggest sigh rolling of eyes you could ever get. She was so rude I could not believe it. Clearly this girl needs to work elsewhere. Good was good and the service was just ok. Our one daughter ordered the petite steak I took about 15 minutes for just the steak to come out all said I would not come back to this location.

Crappy food!!!!!! 60 bucks later and huge waste of money.We went in on a Sunday and now wonder hardy anyone was there.The floor was so filthy I almost left just for that reason! Would not go here again!!!!!!! Waitress was nice that was the only good in it.

I'm really unsure as to how this chain of restaurants stays open. They've had poor, service, mediocre food - at best and been very much in need of a facelift for nearly a decade now.  I seem to find the worst and and slowest service to be when there are very few people in the joint. How can this be? Nonetheless, I think this will be it for me and TGI Friday's. Breaking up has brought on nothing short of unhappiness.
Had the most amazing burgers and great service! Nia is the best sever and always on top of it! :)

Karaoke with my buddy Roy and friends at TGIF last night! Terry HD does a fantastic job with the songs and what a great crowd! Food is fantastic and Jess the bartender took great care of everyone! I'll be back!

After waiting 15 minutes to get my order taken and then 15 more to get my drink I actually gave Fridays a second chance and they cut me off after my first beer!!!! There food and the manager (who looks stoned) plus the bar tender( brunette with glasses) were absolutely horrid. Fridays is usually good but there is not one good place about this place. DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!

FRIST OFF this place is a tripple D Dingy, Dirty, & Dark ! I've never been interested in going to this location just the look of the place is horrible but my gf and I got a gift card & this is the closes Fridays to us. It was supper empty on a Sunday which should have told me something. We were seated right away due to the empyness. After the waitress took out drink ordere it was like she feel into a black hole as she took a good 15min until she reappeared to take our order.          We ordered chips and salsa thinking that would be quick to bring out (we were starving). Ya we were wrong it too cause we didn't see her for another 15min. Then when we finally got it the chips were hard & burnt.        Then another 15-20min go by and we get our food.  I ordered the Cajun shrimp & chicken pasta. Pretty much it was a bowl of noodles & grease with about four shrimp. The chicken look so suspect I didn't even teast it.        Yaaaaa won't be going back to like ever !

Can't complain as far as the service, food, and drinks. It's not a fancy restaurant so I don't expect fancy service, but the service I've received was more than average. I think one of the downsides of this place is that some knuckleheads like to sit outside and make comments to people passing by.

Our server Elezar was cool at first.  We ordered 3 tropical iced teas & 1 regular iced tea.  He brought us strawberry iced tea.  When we asked for refills he said there were no refills but forgot to tell us.  He then brought us tropical iced teas then charged us for 3 different iced teas.  The manager was a douche bag.

Went here last week with my husband, really bad idea. The place was half empty and we wanted to sit somewhere little quiet, there were couple tables empty and nobody sitting next to it but we were told they do not serve there so we had to sit in between two families with little kids running around and screaming. But we were so hungry and tired we just wanted to have nice meal. I ordered steak, shrimps with broccoli and fries, my husband got Jack Daniels ribs with fries. Service wasn't great , it took the guy 10 min to bring ur drinks ( he was serving only two other tables) Food came out and only thing that was good was steak thats one star there otherwise if I could I wouldn't give none. My shrimps were salty, brocolli disgusting and fries felt like it was cooked yesterday. My husbands ribs horrible, he used to love it because that Jack Daniels sauce but thats it, it was dry, just a little of meat between bones and fries were not good either. Normaly I would return it and walk out of there but because we were really hungry and tired we eat it. So the food is D- and service the guy brought us drinks and then he stopped by with the check, we had to stop him three times to get more soda, more napkins and check. And the price for this "beautiful night" $55 without tip. Horrible food, bad service and its dark, old and really dirty ( whipe the floors at least once a day). Unless they will do something with this place I won't come back.

My family and I wanted to get a bite to eat after shopping at the mall. We stepped outside and saw TGI Friday's. There was a sign that kids eat free Monday and Tuesday. It was Monday after 6pm and we went in. There was no host or hostess. We were standing there for five minutes and was never greeted by anyone. I saw servers walking around but again no acknowledgement. We left and decided to take our business elsewhere. Very disappointed, makes me wonder how they keep these chain restaurants open especially advertising that it is a family oriented restaurant.

Very disappointed. We have been to the location in Burbank and had a great experience. However we won't be going back to this location EVER. In the women's restroom the toilet wouldn't flush and one of their faucets were broken. The waitress never refilled my drink. The kids burgers were more like sliders. The kids fruit had canned pineapples not fresh. The French fries were gross. We asked for a fresh batch thinking they were old, and they still weren't good. My husband ordered the French dip and it is a very tiny sandwich. It tasted like it had canned onions on it. My husband eats just just about everything but he was very unhappy with his food. I had Fajatias and the meat was very undercooked to my taste and I wasn't asked how well done I wanted it. Definitely wouldn't be going back to that location.  Oh I forgot, my son ordered a kids milkshake and he received blended ice milk. Gross. Who doesn't know how to make a milkshake.
Great place. Shrimp cocktail is great along with Stella. Service is good. Nice atmosphere. Great place to eat on a Friday night. Will go there again.
I hate this place. I've never been kicked out of a bar in my life. All I said to the waiter was I want water but I guess his panties were on too tight and he kicked me out. Don't go here

The server who works in the bar area (The one who looks like Lt. Dan from Forest Gump) is the biggest douche. My friends broke up a fight one night and he then denied them service. Every time we have been back since he has provided sub par service. My friends have never caused a scene. The one time they help a guy who is getting his ass kicked, they get punished. Fuck you Lt. Dan. I hated Apollo 13 anyway. (UPDATE: Lt Dan doesn't work here anymore)

A solid place to chill. Mimi is my home girl. But Gary Sinise is a Prom Queen. Those muscles are totally not cute. They remind me of Anchor arms from spongebob square pants. When he takes my order all l want to do is ask him to put several sharp objects on a plate so I can kill myself to avoid looking at his fake anchor arms.

Our server was rude and seemed slightly racist! I would watch how he reacted with white customer he would be happy go lucky. But when he came to my group there was no smiles and not happiness in his services. The drink I ordered was made improperly. This is the first and last time!
I'm trying to delete this review I don't like leaving a bad review on anybody , it's not letting m

I would do no stars if it was possible, unfortunately this is the closest Fridays we have, the first time we came here it was ok it was pretty busy for them and the service was ok the food was good, the second time we came was after a fun day at six flags and we were starving, this time around the service was worse, our waitress took about a good 20 min to bring us water, and even longer to take our order, it was taking so long to get our food and it was pretty late, we live about 30 min away and we were tired so we asked another waitress who happens to pass by to let them know we are actually going to take our food to go, after that our food came in that same minute, our original waitress came  back and brought us our good and said it was on the house, my friend and I didn't mind paying for the food and never coming back but we took the food and left, needless to said I will never come back.

The place was really quiet, calm. Not too busy on a Tuesday night where kids eat free!!! That was an unexpected bonus. The waitress was very attentive and pleasant to talk to. She came and checked in on us every 10 min. Our drink and food orders came fast. It was a pleasant experience.  My family would definitely come back.

This Friday's is pretty good.  They have a special where two people can share an appetizer and each get an entrée for $20.  I have done this special a few times over the past year and find that it is enough food and it is a good price.  I find the food to be good quality for the price.
Our waitress, Christina, was great at up sales.  She actually had more knowledge of menu than any waitress I've seen.   Excellent service.  She restored my faith in this chain

I recently moved to Sacramento from the LA area (where I was born and raised)  and I had my going away dinner here with some of my close friends at TGIFridays! What a great experience! our waitress was so awesome, she was really patient with everyone as it was a larger party and she spent a good amount of time at our table. Our drinks were always full and she took the time to separate all the checks, which I am sure was a nightmare. The food was great for happy hour food and rather cheap as well. The drinks were consistent and good every time(touché bartender!) . This is fridays, a cool weekend spot for a non-special occasion but a place you take your wife to for your wedding anniversary. For this reason I feel that I had a 5 star experience. The wait staff, prices and food & drinks were beyond my expectations. Thank you Friday's staff, my friends and I thoroughly enjoyed ourselves while saying goodbye for now and your excellent service made it easy for us!

OMG this is the worst TGI ever! I did not Yelp it first because I assumed the brand is consistent everywhere.  Oh how wrong I was.  Our waitress was totally fine.  It took 20 minutes to get any food.  It seems like they were only focused in the bar as there were only a couple if families eating.  I got the fried shrimp and it was obviously old and had been retried to heat, making it a soggy disgusting mess.  My daughters fries were so smushy and limp that the texture was similar to mashed potatoes.   The owner must make all the money off of liquor because the food is horrendous.
Great food and drinks! The server was very nice and brought everything quick. Get the happy hour 9 pm to close!

My only complaint is the bar tenders. By far the most unfriendly. Sat at the (empty) bar and still took the bartender a while to acknowledge us. Then he disappeared for a good 10 min while I'm starving and ready to order. To me it seems like this guy is bitter and hates his job. Needless to say, I won't be coming back any time soon.

We've been coming here for about a year now. We always get great service. And we always take advantage of happy hour prices on appetizers and drinks. This place is also good for the whole family including kids.

If I can rate this place in negative stars, I would. I called in 15 minutes ahead of time to be on the waitlist and I was told it would be 1 hour and 45 minutes, and when I arrived  20 minutes later, it was still the same wait time despite me already being on the list. I clearly seen empty tables for my family and asked politely about those tables and I was told very rudely "I told you when you got here, you're going to wait 1 hour and 45 minutes." Perhaps if my name was Britney with blonde hair, I would have gotten better service.

We went here last weekend. It was horrible. It took 20 minutes to get our drinks. The food came after being there for 40 minutes. It was nasty. The spinach dip looked like vomit on a plate. My burger was rare when I asked for medium. The waiter asked if I wanted another drink,  I declined and asked for an ice tea. He forgot about it and brought it out with the check. If it wasn't the holiday season I wouldn't have tipped him anything. Fridays had their time. Now it's over. I'll never go back.
Ordered a jack damiels chicken sandwhich for take out. It was delicious. Nice and juicy. No complains here.

I've been to a few TGI Friday's up and down the coast and this is the worst, by far, it might be one of the worst restaurants I've ever been to. It's dark and dingy. The service was slow, and the food was awful. I ordered a medium rare steak and it was cold in the middle, like ice cold. My daughter's pizza looked like a frozen red barron heated up in the microwave. Everything was bad.

So after sitting and waiting for 27 minutes in an empty restaurant at 1145, the bar keep, after getting snapped at by us, finally took our drink and food order for a party of 4, 3 adults and 1 kid.   Original "waitress" told bar keep it wasn't her table.  Cause the nasty looks will keep coming and bar keep will get a decent tip.   Haven't been here since I was a kid so I was looking foward to eating here, very disappointing. So after 1 hour,  we finally got our drinks and our food arrived shortly after. Rating a 2 star because the burger, beer and step up from the bar keep to help us.  Overall, very disappointed in this visit, especially with the waitress arguing over who's table was who's.  Can't believe it took us to threaten to walk out to get help at our table.  Honestly, I don't see coming back to this location anytime soon.   2 hours after showing up, eating our food and drinks, the manager finally came by and asked about our visit.  We said OK then she walked away.

The service here is just plain awful! Our waitress was rude, never refilled our drinks, and did not allow my brothers to do the all you can eat appetizers. Apparently there is a rule that everybody at the table is supposed to order unlimited apps, but my other set of little brothers would not have been able to eat anything off that menu. I tried explaining to the waitress that my other brothers who were 4&5 years old would not eat those apps, but she still refused. I should have left at that point, but I only stayed because I knew my siblings were starving. Our food came out relatively quick. The kids got the pizza and fries, but the pizza was kinda soggy. My fiancé got the fish and chips and said they were really greasy. I got the buffalo chicken sandwich with onion rings and it was good. I felt horrible leaving a tip, but I was just being nice. I really shouldn't have though for the type of service I got.  My suggestion is to only come here for drinks and appetizers. Everything else pretty much sucks. Also, don't go so late at night when you can hear drunk people singing awful karaoke! And don't orde water because it tastes really nasty! I don't know if I would ever come back....I'll see.

For my birthday dinner, Schoolteacher asked where I would like to eat dinner. Looking through my remaining birthday emails, I realized it had been some time since I'd been to this TGI Fridays. Certainly long before my yelp days. So, I asked if we could have dinner here. Plus, I had a free birthday desert email.      We parked up on the top level of the parking structure, and then walked down to the restaurant. Turns out on Thursdays they've actually got a farmers market happening here within the shopping plaza. We poked around the vendors selling their jewelries, and their fruits and vegetables. While wandering around, I bought her a bouquet of flowers, we tried some local salsa, and then we finally meandered into TGI Fridays.       The place was fairly empty, and we were quickly greeted and seated in the bar area by the hostess. The table between us was fairly tiny, and when the waitress brought the free chips and salsa because I'm a member of that stripes club, I had to move them up to the top of the wall between us and the booth on the other side.  The waitress who worked with us was extremely helpful, knowledgeable and quick. She was really good at her job and quite honestly made the whole night better.       After perusing the menu and accidentally playing footsie with schoolteacher beneath the tiny tiny table, I went with the Cajun Shrimp & chicken Pasta. Schoolteacher went with the far healthier Chipotle Yucatan Chicken Salad. We chatted about our days and the discovery of the farmers market while waiting for our foods to come out, which wasn't too long afterwards.       The food was presented well, and delivered hot. My Cajun pasta was tasty, and Schoolteacher's salad was also good.  After eating the massive pasta meal, I was pretty stuffed, and asked helpful waitress lady which desert kept best. She suggested a few, and from among those I chose the Red Velvet cake with ice cream.  Helpful waitress lady even had the cake separately packed from the ice cream, as to not cause soggy Red Velvet Cake. She also had the chips and salsa packed up, being careful to pour the salsa into sealed containers so they didn't spill on the chips and soggy them up either.  I really did like helpful waitress lady. She was super helpful and really on the ball.      As we wrapped up dinner and exited, I thanked waitress lady and hostess girl on our way out of the place. I also thanked Schoolteacher for picking up the bill.  It was a pretty good night all around. Thanks everybody! You made my birthday dinner pretty dang great!

So we went in for the BOGO (Buy one get one free dinner) it was a Tues night and hardly anyone was there so plenty of empty tables but we got sat at an uncomfortable table in the very back by the server station and back door where everyone went out to smoke. Why? I have no idea...The view was horrible. All we could see were cleaning supplies, the kitchen and whatever it was behind the server station. The waiter wasn't any better. He seemed new and lacked personality among much knowledge of the food or drinks served there. We ordered the steak and lobster which seemed to be the ticket for the night but it wasn't all that good. The lobster wasn't cooked and the rest was just bla. The bill for 3 people even with the one free dinner came to $82 and we left feeling that we much rather spend that kind of money elsewhere. Not a memorable night at all. Probably won't ever go back. Too many better places to enjoy and spend our time and money on...Sorry...This place isnt good...Waste! :-(

You know, for years this place was known for being *THE* place for greasy pub food, reasonably priced drinks and for being both an after work hangout or a "first date" kind of place.  Well, a couple weeks go, I found that they were offering a 15% rebate offer on my PayForward Card, so we had to give it a try.   We were surprised- the menu was full of tasty & fresh options, even healthy eating!  Well we all tried something different - (and with extra appetizers since they were half-off) and everyone really enjoyed their food. The burgers were huge and juicy, the freshly made potato chips were salty/crispy goodness and the other dishes measured up. Hint- get the chips, not the fries! Sure, not exactly ***** posh dining- but a great place to go with friends and have a fun meal at a reasonable price.  (Of course the 15% PayForward card rebate made it even better.) And don't worry- there still is plenty of greasy pub food & reasonably priced drinks on the menu, and dudes still gather there after work.  No problems with the service also.

This is my coworkers to to place after a saturday nights. It's usually karaoke night and the place is pretty packed! We def take advantage of happy hour which isn't bad! We get the buffalo wings and fries! And that usually does the trick while we drink! Service is great at the bar. Now if you sit at a table or booth in the bar just be advised that service will suck. You have to get your servers attention, but it's understanding with the way it gets packed. The servers are super friendly and nice! Def a good place to grab some drinks!

Our waitress Julia, was very attentive and friendly. Our drinks tasted very good, could've had alittle more alcohol but overall good. Our meals were brought to us quickly and were visually delightful. Overall, we had a good experience and would reccomend this location.
I'm shocked no one has mentioned how bad this place smells, like honestly smells like a sewage line is being emptied there. Just by smell alone this place deserves 2 stars.
I'm not sure why this place has a low rating, I personally love it. The best nachos and strawberry margarita. Wednesday karaoke nights are very fun.:)

This place is dark, dirty and service is slow. It's almost empty and we waited for 20 min without being checked on. Gave me enough time to look at the food crud that was still stuck to my table..and the small pieces of trash that were left by the dirty salt and pepper shakers. We walked out before being attended to. I'm sure we didn't miss out on much considering the lack of hygiene . I'm glad we were ignored. Thanks TGIF.

Wow, I tipped for nothing, the ribs were old, the chicken was a reheat , the first drink was like water, the shrimp seem old too. I woke us in the morning and was dizzy, wanted to throw up. The most physically damaging eating in 20 years. My advice if it doesn't look good don't put it in your mouth. I hope I survive. No really, I'm not good right now.
Visiting this area from San Diego. This is bet best tgi Fridays I've been to on a Saturday night! Karaoke night was awesome! Staff was awesome! Would visit again!

When you go in based on Internet web page listed specials.   And order what's there.   1.  Mojito (house) 1. Long Island ice tea (house) Special says 3$ each and your bill is 16+.  Damn.  There's a reason this place is dead.   Even during a Clipper playoff game it's dead.   So take head all those that listen to my reviews.   Stay away.   For a great happy hour, hit up Salt Creek.   As for the picture.   I enjoy the ring up for the Ultimate L.I.I.T.    Side note.    Dig the manager consistently checking the computer for updated sales.  Bad move.   Just reeks of desperation.   And yes, I know what I speak of. This place is a waste-of-time.

Poor, slow service! Restaurant wasn't busy, but it took them 10 minutes to seat us, another 15 minutes for a server to ask us what we wanted to drink, and 30 minutes to bring us our drinks because they had to brew more tea Then, after ordering appetizers, it took them forever to bring it out. To make matters worse, it took forever for our main courses to be served. Mind you, we arrived at the restaurant at 5:30pm and left at 8:40pm.  To add to this review, the restaurant was dark, dingy, and dirty. They didn't clean the floors after a huge party had left and the restaurant was empty. Does anyone work here? It also smelled pretty funky

Here's a clue-Sunday's at TGIF in the bar! Sunday has happy hour prices all day! Wife & I ordered 1 slider each, basket of fries, order of wings (10 big wings!), ultimate margarita, 2 9oz glasses of quality wine and a 20oz beer...all for $35. Can't beat it...but you can top it with ultimate great service by Leah...she's attentive, quick, friendly and an asset to TGIF.  They also had multiple tv's for sports, so we got to watch a Dodger game too! Well done tgif!

Was there Sunday July 19 2015 @ lunch time  our  server Eliot had a horrible  attitude since we arrived we were greated with attitude took  order with attitude brung food throwing the straws and drinks by this time we were in shock Eliot  needs to be retrained on manners I go to this restaurant at least 2 x a week  since its close to my job but will definitely keep going this is just a warning if Eliot  is your server you will get horrible service and might end up unsatisfied  with the service plus end up like us keaving the  restaurant after that service with that waiter
My favorite go to drinking spot. Great Prices during happy hour!  Yummy tip: Go on a Sunday and order a basket of fries with a side of BEER CHEESE. You won't regret it

We drove up from Burbank on a Sunday afternoon for 1/2 price appetizers and even though it was over 100 degrees and we had to put up with traffic, it was so worth the trip! My son said his chicken quesadillas were the best he has tasted. We shared the crispy green bean fries and they were wonderful! I also ordered the grilled sliders. I was worried that 3 small burgers would not be enough, but I could not even eat the 3rd one. They were larger than I expected and absolutely delicious! To top it off, the waitress was very attentive to our needs! I wish we lived closer but we will be back very soon!

A group of us went here for lunch the other day and  had a couple of burgers and a club sandwich and it was really good food! The serving staff was great!! And the drinks I got were strong, which is a complete A++ in my book. Also the happy hour here is pretty bomb, it's like $4.50 for a 17 oz Guiness! Our quick bite to eat here turned out pretty awesome.

The food is terrible. Nothing tastes fresh and everything is bland. It is only good for late night drinks. The best thing to accompany a light night drink is some bar food and it's unfortunate that it's so bad. The service is better if you are sitting inside versus outside. The only thing this place has going for it is that it has great late night hours.

Some of the worst service I have ever experienced. Thought I'd give this place another shot after my last nightmare experience. Nothing has changed. Service sucks, food comes out cold. Drinks come out room temperature. Don't waste your time or money here!
The sezilling chicken and shrimp tastes pretty good, and bloody marry is perfect. quiet environment is fabulous.

I'm so sad this place is shutting down! This was my favorite place to watch football I hope they open up somewhere else in town. The food was awesome, the service was great, and most importantly very fair prices! Thank you TGIF for all your great memories
This location is closing November  2015. Greedy mall landlord wants 'mo money . Very sad news.
I hear they're closing because Westfield Mall has found another tenant. I'm devastated. I love TGIF

I am glad this location is closing down forever. My order was wrong, more expensive, and pretty much inedible. This was already a pretty gross restaurant to begin with but they have given up all hope. The waitress uncomfortably came to our table at the end of our meal and demanded that we tip her a specific amount, and forced us to divide that amount evenly among everyone in our party.  Nobody here cares about anything anymore. Truly this is a TGIFridays of the damned.

Extremely glad this location is closing. Jack and cokes aren't considered well drinks, yet bartenders will recommend them after I ask about their happy hour. So I was happily awaiting a $15 check and got a check with almost double that amount. After complaining, the bartender shrugged and said he had to do what he had to do to sell drinks. What???
